1.text: Be my imitators, even as I imitate Christ.

2.text: Now I praise you, brethren, that you remember me in all things, and hold firm to the traditions as I delivered them to you.

3.text: But I desire you to know that the head of every man is Christ, the head of the woman is the man, and the head of Christ is God.

4.text: Every man praying or prophesying with his head covered dishonors his head.

5.text: But every woman praying or prophesying with her head unveiled dishonors her head, and it is as if she were shaved.

6.text: Indeed, if a woman does not wear a head covering, she should be shaved; and if it is shameful for a woman to be shorn or shaved, then let her be covered.

7.text: Certainly, a man should not have his head covered, because he is the image and glory of God, but woman is the glory of man.

8.text: Man is not from woman, but woman from man;

9.text: for man was not created for the woman, but woman for the man.

10.text: For this cause, a woman should have [a sign of] authority on her head, because of the angels.

11.text: Nevertheless, in the Lord, a man is not independent from the woman, nor is a woman independent from the man.

12.text: For as woman came from man, so a man also comes [to life] through a woman; but all things are from God.

13.text: Judge for yourselves: is it appropriate that a woman pray to God unveiled?

14.text: Does not even nature itself teach you that if a man has long hair, it is a dishonor to him?

15.text: But if a woman has long hair, it is a glory to her, because her hair is given to her as a covering.

16.text: Now, if anyone wishes to dispute these things, we have no such custom, and neither do the Churches of God.

17.text: Yet, in giving you this instruction, I do not praise you, as you come together not for the better but for the worse.

18.text: First of all, when you come together as Church, I hear that divisions take place among you, and I partly believe it.

19.text: Indeed, there must also be factions among you, so that those who are approved may be revealed among you.

20.text: As it is, when you gather together, it is not the Lord’s Supper that you eat,

21.text: because each one takes his own supper first! One is hungry, and another is drunk!

22.text: Do you not have houses where you can eat and drink? Or do you despise God’s Church and put to shame those who have nothing? What shall I tell you? Shall I praise you? In this, I do not praise you.

23.text: For I received from the Lord what also I delivered to you, that the Lord Jesus, on the night in which he was betrayed, took bread.

24.text: When he had given thanks, he broke it, and said, “Take, eat. This is my body, which is broken for you. Do this in memory of me.”

25.text: Likewise, he also took the cup, after supper, saying, “This cup is the new covenant in my blood. Do this, as often as you drink, in memory of me.”

26.text: For as often as you eat this bread and drink this cup, you proclaim the Lord’s death until he comes.

27.text: Therefore, whoever eats this bread or drinks the Lord’s cup in an unworthy manner will be guilty of the body and blood of the Lord.

28.text: But let everyone do a self-examination, and then eat the bread and drink from the cup.

29.text: For whoever eats and drinks unworthily eats and drinks judgment to himself, if such a one does not discern the body of the Lord.

30.text: For this reason, many among you are weak and sick, and many have fallen asleep.

31.text: For if we discerned ourselves, we would not be judged,

32.text: but when we are judged, we are chastised by the Lord, so that we may not be condemned with the world.

33.text: Therefore, my brethren, when you come together for the Meal, wait for one another.

34.text: But anyone who is hungry should eat at home, for fear that your coming together might be for judgment. Other matters I will set in order when I come.
